intro.para: In this section we extend what we learned about linear maps \RNr[n]\to \RNr[m] to subvector spaces of \RNr[k].

def.caption: Linear transformation
def.para: Let V and W be subvector spaces of \RNr[k]. A linear transformation from V to W is a function L\from V\to W such that

li.para: Additivity L(\Vect{x}+\Vect{y}) = L(\Vect{x}) + L(\Vect{y}) for all \Vect{x}, \Vect{y} in V.
Commutes with scalar multiplication L(t\Vect{x}) = t L(\Vect{x}) for all \Vect{x} in V and all t in \RNr.
